business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and FMCG stocks drive early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 98.36 points to 77,171.80, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.20 points to 23,413.95 as of 9:30 AM.

Donald Trump is a dealmaker: WEF President Børge Brende on potential US trade tariffsWorld Economic Forum President Børge Brende said while some tariffs may be introduced by the US administration, Donald Trump's ultimate goal will likely be to negotiate favourable deals.
Want to avoid paying credit card annual fees? Here are 3 easy tipsSometimes banks may waive your annual fees as a goodwill gesture, if you are a loyal customer with a good credit history.

Global elites' wealth grew 3x faster in 2024; 4 new billionaires weekly: OxfamOxfam International, in its latest assessment of global inequality timed to the opening of the World Economic Forum meeting, also predicts at least five trillionaires will crop up over the next decade. A year ago, the group forecast that only one trillionaire would appear during that time.
Budget 2025: How can government make healthcare more affordableThe healthcare sector expects lowered costs on medical equipment in Budget 2025, thereby boosting affordability and accessibility.

Sensex, Nifty rally as banking stocks power markets higher; Zomato falls 7%Share Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex gained 454.11 points to close at 77,073.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 141.55 points to end at 23,344.75.

Zomato shares decline 7% as Q3 profit tumbles over 57%Zomato Stock Price: Soon after the Q3 results were released, Zomato shares sharply declined over 7%, hitting a day's low of Rs 228.80. At market closing, the food delivery giant's shares fell 3.14% to Rs 240.95.

Budget 2025: New income tax bill likely to be introduced for simpler taxationThe bill will be introduced directly in Parliament, wherein stakeholder inputs including taxpayers and experts, would be incorporated, before being finalised.

Ian Bremmer sheds light on impact of Trump's second term In an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Ian Bremmer shared his insights on the implications of Donald Trump's second term for the US, India and the world.
Rallis India share price falls 8% after Q3 results. Should you sell or hold?Shares of Rallis India were down 8% in early trade and were down 6.82% to Rs 269.85 at around 1:56 pm.
Ian Bremmer calls Elon Musk the most powerful man after Donald Trump in USIan Bremmer responded with a yes when asked if Musk is right now the most powerful man in the US after Donald Trump.

Faster PF transfers, direct online claims: Check benefits of new EPFO rulesThe newly introduced measures are expected to minimise the turnaround time, thereby benefiting about 94% of the 13 million claims filed during FY 2024-25.

Sensex jumps 600 points. Why is stock market rising today?Stock market today: While volatility on Dalal Street rose during the trading session, gains in major shares such as Kotak Mahindra Bank, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, SBI and Reliance Industries contributed to the market gains.

Paytm Q3 FY25 results: Revenue surges to Rs 1,828 crore, gets closer to profitabilityThe growth was propelled by the company's robust payments business and an expanding portfolio in financial services distribution.

Bankrupt airline Go First's liquidation plea approved by law tribunalGo First's lenders decided to liquidate the bankrupt budget carrier's assets in August of last year after rejecting bids by interest suitors.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price surged 15% todayVodafone Idea stock: The shares hit the day's high of Rs 10.48, rising close to 15% after it closed at Rs 9.12 in the previous session. 10.03

UK's richest 10% took half of colonial India's wealth: ReportA report mentioned that colonialism was responsible for ruining Indian industrial output by imposing strict protectionist policies which prevented Asian textiles from competing in the global market.
Paytm share price gains after reporting Q3 results. Check details herePaytm shares were up 1.44% to Rs 912.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:25 am.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Pardon Capitol rioters, exit Paris climate treaty: Trump signs 1st executive ordersWhile Trump signed eight executive orders in front of his supporters inside the Capital One Arena in Washington D.C. on Monday, the rest were signed after he returned to the Oval Office later in the day.

Pics: S Jaishankar's first row first column seat at Trump's inaugurationExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar was seated in the first row at Donald Trump's inauguration as the 47th US President, while his Japanese and Australian counterparts were in the third row.

Trump roasts Biden and Harris, uses swearing-in speech for revengeDonald Trump used his speech after his swearing-in ceremony to take apart the four years of the Joe Biden-Kamala Harris administration. Biden by then had granted pardons to all and sundry. So, the roast was the best revenge that Trump could take. The toughest for the liberal leaders must have been Trump attacking them over restrictions on free speech.

Why Vivek Ramaswamy won't serve in Trump's Department of Government EfficiencyWhen Donald Trump picked Vivek Ramaswamy and Elon Musk to lead DOGE in November, he exuded confidence in the duo and said they would contribute to his 'Save America' moment.
Usha Vance to Ivanka Trump: Monotone magic wins Inauguration Day fashionInauguration Day witnessed several stylish moments, including Usha Vance and Ivanka Trump's monotone looks.

US human rights body sues Trump over executive order ending birthright citizenshipDonald Trump Swearing In Ceremony Live Updates: Donald Trump took oath as the 47th US President at the Capitol Rotunda in Washington DC on Monday (local time). The inauguration ceremony was shifted indoors because of freezing cold. Trump vowed to act swiftly after the ceremony, signing the first round of executive orders already prepared on immigration and border security. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar represented India at Trump's inauguration event. Follow India Today for all the latest updates.

Trump credits son Barron for helping him win young voters, his reaction is viralAs Barron raised his hands in the air to acknowledge the cheering crowd, Trump said, "He knew the youth vote. We won the youth vote by 36 points."

Day 10 Live: Zverev wins 1st set vs Paul, Badosa beats Gauff to enter semisAustralian Open 2025, Day 10 Live Updates: Alexander Zverev has won the 1st set against Tommy Paul in the 1st quarter-final. Earlier, Paula Badosa beat Coco Gauff in the first quarter-final of the women's singles at the Rod Laver Arena. Later in the day, Rohan Bopanna will be in action as we build up to the blockbuster Carlos Alcaraz vs Novak Djokovic clash.

Elon Musk's back-to-back 'Nazi salutes' at Trump event sparks controversyOn Monday, the tech billionaire took to the stage at the Capital One Arena in Washington D.C., pumping his arms and screaming "yes" to a rousing crowd of Trump supporters.

Trump says he will tariff and tax foreign countries. Trouble for India?US President Donald Trump vowed to overhaul the country's trade system and would impose tariffs and taxes on foreign countries to protect Americans. But would Trump's tariff plans affect India, which he once called the "king of tariffs"?

US will recognize only two genders - male and female: Trump's strike at DEIAnnouncing actions on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) programs, newly-appointed US President Donald Trump said that from now onwards America will have only two genders -- male and female.

Saif Ali Khan to be discharged from hospital today: DoctorActor Saif Ali Khan will be discharged from the hospital on January 21. He was hospitalised at Mumbai's Lilavati hospital after being stabbed during a burglary bid at his Bandra house.

US Senator walks into Trump inauguration in sweatshirt and shorts, video is viralDemocratic Senator John Fetterman attended Donald Trump's oath taking ceremony at the US Capitol Rotunda and wore a black hoodie, grey shorts and sneakers despite the biting cold.

RG Kar convict Sanjay Roy gets life term: What next for him, victim's family?The convict can challenge the order of conviction and sentence before the Kolkata High Court. The CBI also has the provision to seek an enhancement of the sentence to death before a higher court.

'We love you, America': Biden shares last selfie as US President from White HouseThe President shared a heart-warming photograph from his official POTUS handle, featuring a smiling couple posing together in front of the White House.

To make America un-woke again, Trump vows revolution of common senseDonald Trump's presidency has kicked off with an unprecedented wave of executive actions aimed at dismantling "woke ideologies" and reshaping federal policies. He has vowed a revolution of common sense. From restoring "biological reality" on IDs to ending DEI programs, Trump 2.0 signals a hard stress on his campaign promises.

Meet Prashant Tamang, the sniper in Paatal Lok 2 and former Indian Idol winner Prashant Tamang, who plays Sniper Daniel Lecho in Paatal Lok Season 2, is a former Indian Idol winner and has acted in several Nepali films. The crime drama, currently streaming on Prime Video, also stars Jaideep Ahlawat and Ishwak Singh.

Minutes before Trump's oath, Biden pardons family members in final moveMinutes before leaving the White House, Joe Biden pardoned five members of his family, including his brothers, James and Francis Biden, his sister, Valerie Biden, and their spouses.

Trump says may impose 25% tariffs on Canada, Mexico from Feb 1: Very bad abuserUS President Donald Trump made the threat against the two major US trading partners hours after taking the oath of office -- and promised to make liberal use of tariffs as a foreign policy tool.

Pakistan rejoices over Gwadar airport, China dubs it donationThe newly inaugurated Gwadar airport in Balochistan has been branded a "donation" by the Chinese Communist Party's mouthpiece, Global Times. This even as Pakistan hailed the USD 230-million airport as a "symbol of friendship". Critics are calling it another cog in Beijing's debt-trap diplomacy.

Elon Musk-led DOGE faces several lawsuits hours after Donald Trump takes officeUS President Donald Trump has created an advisory group, the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), to drastically cut the US government. Co-run by Elon Musk, DOGE aims to eliminate federal agencies and cut three-quarters of government jobs.

Man visits police station to file complaint in Chennai, sets himself on fireA man who came to a police station in Chennai to reportedly file a complaint set himself on fire outside it and suffered severe burn injuries.

4 male staffers were present during Saif Ali Khan attack, didn't intervene: SourcesFour male staff helpers were present inside Saif Ali Khan's home at the time of the stabbing attack, but none intervened to stop the intruder, sources said. One hid himself while the others remained paralysed with fear, they added.

Video: Chris Martin, Dakota Johnson get a taste of Mumbai during India visitColdplay's lead vocalist Chris Martin and his actor-girlfriend Dakota Johnson were seen roaming the streets of Mumbai during their India visit. A video of them enjoying their visit is now going viral on social media.

sports.headline: SA20: David Miller powers Paarl Royals to six-wicket win over Joburg Super KingsPaarl Royals registered a clinical win over Joburg Super Kings by six wickets in Match 15 to get to the top of the points table. Jonny Bairstow was adjudged Player of the Match despite his half-century ending in a losing cause.

Their partnership begins at the Indonesian Open against Taiwan's Shuo Yun Sung.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz Round 8: All you need to know about Australian Open quartersNovak Djokovic, the 10-time Australian Open champion, is determined to prove a point to his naysayers after failing to win a Grand Slam last year. The Serb faces a significant challenge as early as the quarter-finals, where he will take on Carlos Alcaraz on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Alcaraz will be aiming for his first victory over Djokovic on hard courts.

Axar Patel on being named as T20I vice-captain: Don't have to prove anythingAxar Patel was named the vice captain of the Indian team for the T20I series. Asked about the transitioning side and the fact that he was named the deputy to Suryakumar Yadav, Axar gave a sharp response to the media in Kolkata.

Iga Swiatek reaches quarterfinals with dominant win, injured Monfils crashes outAustralian Open: Former World No.1 Iga Swiatek continued her brilliant run in the tournament. She knocked out Lucky Loser Eva Lys in the fourth round of the competition in straight sets. In the men's division, Gael Monfils' terrific run ended due to an ankle injury.

Neeraj and Himani met in the United States, reveals javelin star's uncleTwo-time Olympic medallist javelin star Neeraj Chopra's uncle, Surendra Chopra, shared that the Olympian met his wife, Himani Mor, in the United States. The couple got to know each other there before eventually tying the knot.

Jab Neeraj met Himani: Olympian's uncle shares couple's love story Neeraj Chopra's uncle, Surendra Chopra, revealed details about the Olympian's destination wedding in Shimla in an interview with India Today. The Olympic medallist tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend, Himani Mor, a former tennis player.

Musk's swipe at legacy media after Djokovic posts video, tennis star concursNovak Djokovic subtly acknowledged Elon Musk's support after an Australian journalist's controversial comments. The Serbian tennis star remained composed amidst criticism, showing his resilience during the Australian Open 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
